qas.question: What were the two turbo controllers Nintendo made for the NES?

answers.text: NES Advantage and the NES Max

qas.question: What did the Turbo feature allow players to do?

answers.text: shoot much faster during shooter games

qas.question: Which controller had a non-adjustable Turbo feature?
Which two accessories were featured in the movie The Wizard?

answers.text: Power Pad and the Power Glove

qas.question: The NES Max also did not feature what?
What were the third turbo controllers Nintendo made for the NES?

plausible_answers.text: shoot much faster during shooter games

qas.question: What did the Turbo feature not allow players to do?
Which controller had a adjustable Turbo feature?

plausible_answers.text: Power Pad and the Power Glove

qas.question: Which three accessories were featured in the movie The Wizard?
The SNES Max also did not feature what?

context: Nintendo also made two turbo controllers for the NES called <a0_0>NES Advantage and the <b5_0><b7_0>NES Max<b7_0/><b5_0/><a0_0/>. Both controllers had a Turbo feature, a feature where one tap of the button represented multiple taps. This feature allowed players to <a1_0><b6_0>shoot much faster during shooter games<b6_0/><a1_0/>. The NES Advantage had two knobs that adjusted the firing rate of the turbo button from quick to Turbo, as well as a "Slow" button that slowed down the game by rapidly pausing the game. The "Slow" button did not work with games that had a pause menu or pause screen and can interfere with jumping and shooting. <a2_0>The NES Max<a2_0/> also had the Turbo Feature, but it was not adjustable, in contrast with the Advantage. It also did not have the <a4_0>"<b9_0>Slow<b9_0/>" button<a4_0/>. Its wing-like shape made it easier to hold than the Advantage and it also improved on the joystick. Turbo features were also featured on the NES Satellite, the NES Four Score, and the U-Force. Other accessories include the <a3_0><b8_0>Power Pad and the Power Glove<b8_0/><a3_0/>, which was featured in the movie The Wizard.
